title: Parsec Patrol Diaries: Hello World
author: lmorchard
html:
So, I’ve been working on a retro space game for the web. I planned it as a fun project to “sharpen the saw” and get myself more current on some newer technologies. I also planned to use it as blog fodder, writing little diary entries about what I’ve been doing & discovering along the way. But, 147 commits and almost 4 months later, I’ve had fun doing the coding and have totally neglected the writing.

I just brainstormed a topic list, so maybe I could back-fill with posts about things I did a few months ago. Last month’s stuff is boring to write about, though. Meanwhile, today’s stuff is fresh and exciting. But, since I’ve told myself that I should write about all the things, I feel obligated to go back and do the chores first. So, nothing gets written.

Bah.

But, wait! It just occurred to me that I can do whatever I want! I can totally have pudding before I have any meat. So, I can go all non-linear and just start writing about whatever seems fun, in whatever order strikes my fancy.

Take that, internal editor / critic. Prepare for random access crap!
body:
So, I’ve been working on [a retro space game for the web][1]. I planned it as a fun project to “[sharpen the saw][2]” and get myself more current on some newer technologies. I also planned to use it as blog fodder, writing little diary entries about what I’ve been doing & discovering along the way. But, [147 commits and almost 4 months later][3], I’ve had fun doing the coding and have totally neglected the writing. [I just brainstormed a topic list][4], so maybe I could back-fill with posts about things I did a few months ago. Last month’s stuff is boring to write about, though. Meanwhile, today’s stuff is fresh and exciting. But, since I’ve told myself that I should write about all the things, I feel obligated to go back and do the chores first. So, nothing gets written.

Bah.

But, wait! It just occurred to me that I can do whatever I want! [I can totally have pudding before I have any meat.][5] So, I can go all non-linear and just start writing about whatever seems fun, in whatever order strikes my fancy. Take that, [internal editor / critic][6]. Prepare for random access crap! [1]: http://lmorchard.github.io/parsec-patrol/ [2]: https://www.stephencovey.com/7habits/7habits-habit7.php [3]: https://github.com/lmorchard/parsec-patrol/graphs/commit-activity [4]: https://gist.github.com/lmorchard/7548511 [5]: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n5diMImYIIA [6]: https://www.google.com/search?q=internal+critic
summary: So, I’ve been working on a retro space game for the web. I planned it as a fun project to “sharpen the saw” and get myself more current on some newer technologies. I also planned to use it as blog fodder, writing little diary entries about what I’ve been doing & discovering along the way. But, 147 commits and almost 4 months later, I’ve had fun doing the coding and have totally neglected the writing.
